     Question                                           Answers                                          Notes                Total
1.     a        n(H2SO4) « 0.0500 dm3  0.100 mol dm3»  0.00500/5.00  103«mol» ✔                                          1

1.     b        H2SO4 (aq)  Mg(OH)2 (s)  MgSO4 (aq)  2H2O (l) ✔                      Accept an ionic equation.              1

1.     c                      1                  1
                «n(H2SO4)         n(NaOH)         (0.02080 dm3  0.1133 mol dm3)»
                              2                  2                                                                             1
                0.001178/1.178  10   3
                                           «mol» ✔

1.     d        n(H2SO4) reacted « 0.00500  0.001178»  0.00382/3.82  103 «mol» ✔
                                                                                                                               1

1.     e        n(Mg(OH)2) « n(H2SO4) »  0.00382/3.82  103 «mol» ✔                 Award [2] for correct final answer.

                m(Mg(OH)2) « 0.00382 mol  58.33 g mol1»  0.223 «g» ✔                                                       2


1.     f                          0.223 g                                               Answer must show three significant
                % Mg(OH)2 «                 100»  18.0 «%» ✔
                                  1.24 g                                                figures.
                                                                                                                               1
                                                                            –4–                    M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                                     Answers                          Notes                       Total
2.     a                                                                          M1:
                                                                                  Accept “speed” for x-axis label.
                                                                                  Accept “number of particles”, “N”,
                                                                                  “frequency” or “probability «density»” for
                                                                                  y-axis label.
                                                                                  Do not accept “potential energy” for
                                                                                  x-axis label.



                                                                                  M2:                                           3
                                                                                  Do not accept a curve that touches the
                                                                                  x-axis at high energy.
                                                                                  Do not award M2 if two curves are
                                                                                  drawn.



                both axes correctly labelled ✔                                    M3:
                correct shape of curve starting at origin ✔                       Ignore any shading under the curve.
                Ea(catalyst) < Ea(without catalyst) on x-axis ✔
                                                                          –5–                         M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                         Notes                 Total
2.     b    i




                                                                                                                             1




                 curve starting from origin with steeper gradient AND reaching same
                 maximum volume ✔

2.     b    ii   rate decreases
                 OR
                 slower reaction ✔
                                                                                                                             2
                 «ethanoic acid» partially dissociated/ionized «in solution/water»    Accept “weak acid” or “higher pH”.
                 OR
                 lower [H] ✔
                                                                       –6–                               M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                               Notes                     Total
2.     c        «pH» converts «wide range of [H]» into simple «log» scale/numbers       Accept “uses values between 0/1 and
                                                                                         14”.
                OR
                                                                                         Do not accept “easier to use”.
                «pH» avoids need for exponential/scientific notation
                                                                                         Do not accept “easier for calculations”.
                OR                                                                                                                   1
                «pH» converts small numbers into values «typically» between 0/1 and 14
                OR
                «pH» allows easy comparison of values of [H+] ✔

2.     d        «species» do not differ by a «single» proton/H+                          Do not accept “hydrogen/H” for
                                                                                         “H+/proton”.
                OR
                conjugate base of H3PO4 is H2PO4 «not HPO42»                                                                       1
                OR
                conjugate acid of HPO42- is H2PO4 «not H3PO4» ✔

     Question                                       Answers                        Notes                 Total
3.     a    i




                                                                                                          1




                 4 levels showing convergence at higher energy ✔

3.     a    ii




                                                                                                          1




                 arrows (pointing down) from n  3 to n  2 AND n  4 to n  2 ✔
                                                                         –8–                                        M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                         Answers                                                       Notes                   Total
3.     b    i     same number of shells/«outer» energy level/shielding AND nuclear
                  charge/number of protons/Zeff increases «causing a stronger pull on the outer                                              1
                  electrons» ✔

3.     b    ii    K+ 19 protons AND Cl 17 protons
                  OR
                                                                                                                                             2
                  K+ has «two» more protons ✔
                  same number of electrons/isoelectronic «thus pulled closer together» ✔

3.     c    i
                                                                                                                                             1

3.     c    ii    Anode (positive electrode):
                  Cu(s)  Cu2 (aq)  2e ✔                                                         Accept Cu(s) – 2e-  Cu2+ (aq).
                                                                                                    Accept  for 
                                                                                                                                             2
                  Cathode (negative electrode):                                                     Award [1 max] if the equations are at
                                                                                                    the wrong electrodes.
                  Cu2 (aq)  2e  Cu (s) ✔


3.     c    iii   «external» circuit/wire AND from positive/anode to negative/cathode electrode ✔   Accept “through power supply/battery”
                                                                                                    instead of “circuit”.                    1
                                                                                           –9–                                M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                                       Answers                                                    Notes                Total
4.     a          bonds broken: 4(C–H)  2(H–O) / 4(414)  2(463) / 2582 «kJ» ✔                               Award [3] for correct final answer.

                  bonds made: 3(H–H)  CO / 3(436)  1077 / 2385 «kJ» ✔                                      Award [2 max] for –197 «kJ».
                                                                                                                                                     3

                  H «  BE(bonds broken)   BE(bonds made)  2582  2385»  «» 197 «kJ» ✔

4.     b    i          for any element  0 «by definition»
                  OR                                                                                                                                 1
                  no energy required to form an element «in its stable form» from itself ✔

4.     b    ii    HÖ «                 (products)         (reactants)    111  0  [74.0  (242)]»
                                                                                                                                                     1
                   «» 205 «kJ» ✔

4.     b    iii   «bond enthalpies» averaged values «over similar compounds»
                  OR                                                                                                                                 1
                  «bond enthalpies» are not specific to these compounds ✔



5.     a          Q: non-equilibrium concentrations AND Kc: equilibrium concentrations
                  OR                                                                                                                                 1
                  Q: «measured» at any time AND Kc: «measured» at equilibrium ✔

5.     b                   [SO 3 ]2                 1.00 2                                                    Do not award M2 without M1.
                  «Q                                         »  0.500 ✔
                          S O  O 
                             2
                                 2
                                      2
                                                1.0 0  2.00
                                                     2


                                                                                                                                                     2
                  reverse reaction favoured/reaction proceeds to the left AND
                  Q > Kc/0.500 > 0.282 ✔
                                                                      – 10 –                                       M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                                        Notes                 Total
6.     a    i    polar bonds «between H and group 16 element»
                 OR
                 difference in electronegativities «between H and group 16 element» ✔


                 uneven distribution of charge/electron cloud                                      M2:                                     2
                 OR                                                                                Do not accept “net/overall dipole
                                                                                                   moment” without further explanation.
                 non-linear/bent/V-shaped/angular shape «due to lone pairs»
                                                                                                   Accept “non-symmetrical
                 OR                                                                                «shape/distribution of charge»”.
                 polar bonds/dipoles do not cancel out ✔

6.     a    ii   number of electrons increases ✔                                                   M1: Accept “Mr /Ar increases” or
                                                                                                   “molecules become larger in
                                                                                                   size/mass/surface area”.
                                                                                                                                           2
                 London/dispersion/instantaneous induced dipole-induced dipole forces increase ✔



6.     b         Electron domain geometry:                                                         Both marks can be awarded for clear
                                                                                                   diagrams. Electron domain geometry
                 tetrahedral ✔
                                                                                                   requires a 3-D diagram showing the
                                                                                                   tetrahedral arrangement.                2
                 Molecular geometry:
                 bent/V-shaped/angular ✔
                                                                        – 11 –                                    M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                                      Notes                 Total
7.     a        Physical evidence:                                                                 M1:
                equal C–C bond «lengths/strengths»                                                 Accept “all C–C–C bond angles are
                                                                                                   equal”.
                OR
                regular hexagon
                OR
                «all» C–C have bond order of 1.5
                OR
                «all» C–C intermediate between single and double bonds ✔


                Chemical evidence:
                undergoes substitution reaction «more readily than addition»                                                             2
                OR
                does not discolour/react with bromine water
                OR
                substitution forms only one isomer for 1,2-disubstitution «presence of alternate
                double bonds would form two isomers»
                OR
                more stable than expected «compared to hypothetical molecule
                cyclohexa-1,3,5-triene»
                OR
                enthalpy change of hydrogenation/combustion is less exothermic than
                predicted «for cyclohexa-1,3,5-triene» ✔
                                                                       – 12 –                                  M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                                    Notes                      Total
7.     b    i    3CH3CH2CH2OH (l)  Cr2O72 (aq)  8H (aq)  3CH3CH2CHO (aq)  2Cr3 (aq) 
                 7H2O (l)
                 correct reactants and products ✔
                                                                                                                                           2
                 balanced equation ✔




7.     b    ii   Aldehyde:                                                                     Accept clear diagrams or descriptions of
                                                                                               the processes.
                 by distillation «removed from reaction mixture as soon as formed» ✔
                                                                                                                                           2
                 Carboxylic acid:
                 «heat mixture under» reflux «to achieve complete oxidation to –COOH» ✔

7.     c    i           136
                 «                  2»
                     48  4  16                                                                                                           1
                 C8H8O2 ✔

7.     c    ii   A: C–H «in alkanes, alkenes, arenes»
                 AND                                                                                                                       1
                 B: C=O «in aldehydes, ketones, carboxylic acids and esters» ✔
                                                                       – 13 –                                       M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ2/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                                        Notes                       Total
7.     c    iii   Any two of:                                                                      Do not penalize use of Kekule
                                                                                                   structures for the phenyl group.


                                                                                                   Accept the following structures:
                                               OR C6H5COOCH3 ✔




                                               OR CH3COOC6H5 ✔
                                                                                                                                                 2




                                               OR HCOOCH2C6H5 ✔                                       CH3

                                                                                                               O        H


                                                                                                                   O

                                                                                                   Award [1 max] for two correct
                                                                                                   aliphatic/linear esters with the molecular
                                                                                                   formula C8H8O2.

7.     c    iv    C6H5COOCH3 «signal at 4 ppm (3.7  4.8 range in data table) due to alkyl group
                  on ester» ✔                                                                                                                    1
